medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash, heightened with lead white (partially oxidized) and grey gouache, on tan laid paper toned with brown wash
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
inscribed: Inscribed recto, lower right, in pen and brown ink: Flar; inscribed verso, center, in graphite: Parmigianini/ Richardson CW

makers.displaymaker: Attributed to Biagio Pupini, Italian, active 1511–1551

texts.textentryhtml: N. Lanier (?, Lugt 2886) lower left recto twice; Jonathan Richardson, Sr. (Lugt 2184) lower center; P. Huart (?, Lugt 2084 and 2086) lower left; Frank Jewett Mather, Jr. (Lugt supp. 1853a) lower left

caption: Attributed to Biagio Pupini (Italian, active 1511–1551), formerly North Italian, Sixteenth Century, Grotesque design with unicorn. Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash, heightened with lead white (partially oxidized) and grey gouache, on tan laid paper toned with brown wash; 9.6 × 18.8 cm. Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1947-17)
